title: Follow version metadata in app
body:
## Description

I found that version input doesn't correctly match the current version.
To automatically match the `Cargo.toml` version, I used `env!("CARGO_PKG_VERSION")`.

title: Friendly credential json

milestone.title: Second publish release
milestone.description:
While using this, I found some areas of improvement. Let's do this and launch the second publish release

- [x] upgrade clap version => this would resolve subcommand shortcut problem and other potential improvements. Let's investigate and upgrade this => let's do this in next release
- [x] run pomodoro anywhere: currently pomodoro is ran in a terminal tab. To make input, user needs to find the tab which pomodoro is running first and writes input. This is quite annoying if there are multiple tabs are there (at least I felt inconvenience) => let's do this in next release
- [v] notify user that credential.json is correctly applied or not (if applied then which option is successfully applied)
- [v] notify user that which notifications (default, slack, discord etc) is failed or succeed
- do not interrupt other notifications if one notification failed or made error

body: ## Description To provide whether `--config` option is successfully applied or not, print `configuration report` at the beginning of the application starts. While working on this feature, I found table could be colorized. So I added little color for `configuration report` and `notify report`. ### Demo #### Run pomodoro without --config option #### Run pomodoro wiht proper option

body: ## Description Now after notification expired, it will send notifications in many ways (desktop notification, slack, discord). After sending them, now pomodoro will collect the result and show the `notification result report`. ### consideration Handling the `>` text is quite tricky. Because printing the `notification result report` is asynchronous printing. I don't know handling like this is okay or not. ### To-be Image

title: Update readme & cargo.toml for the first release

milestone.title: Prepare first release
milestone.description:
As gluesql is upgraded, it's time to publish `rust-cli-pomodoro`.
For the release, I think I need to cover this

- [ ] Write test cases so that test coverage is around 80%
- [ ] Revisit and update docs
- [ ] Add gif or demo video in README.md
- [ ] Stable notification feature
    - Notification concurrent support, currently it takes too many times to send notification via http request
    - Because of cross platform and I used this cli myself, notification is not stable. Revisit the logic and make it stable

body:
## Description
Before the first release (`cargo publish I mean`), I update the `README.md` and `Cargo.toml` file.

title: Support notification history
body:
## Description

There would be many options to implement `history` feature.
For me, I need this feature to check how many pomodoros did I consumed.

Based on this purpose, there are two options in my mind
1. add `archived` column for differentiating the archived and non-archived notifications
2. store archived notification in separated table, `archived_notifications` for example.

For me, it seems separating is more attractive because I don't have to care about when focusing on `notifications` table and vice versa. This would save the cost in the future I hope..

This pr is to send http related notifications concurrently. I found that http request delay is quite annoying.

body:
## Description
This pr is writing test cases for several file as much as possible.
Checked the coverage by running this command. 
```sh
cargo tarpaulin --out Html --output-dir reports
```

It's 63%
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34280965/160855649-1bcc881a-46b3-43b4-86ca-71ebf774d388.png)

title: Upgrade gluesql
body:
Since gluesql current version is v0.10.2, I upgraded package version.  
Plus, I resolved cargo clippy warning

title: move cursor to top when clear
body: I found in google. Using this character makes cursor to top and clear the terminal. Tested on Ubuntu 20.04

title: Support discord webhook notification
body:
Implement feature raised in #28 .

For the general usage, I changed credential.json schema.

title: Alert correctly when the notification queued
body:
While using it, I found the bug that when the notification is created by `queue` command, then the alert rings incorrect timing.
So I made a fix

title: Display table pretty with start_at
body:
This pr displays printed table pretty with `start_at` column. `created_at` is deprecated, it's not useful.

So the table would look like this
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34280965/147414225-2f7ddc67-b655-40eb-aef3-4f089f78b4f2.png)

title: Support queue command
body: This pr implements `queue` command. Queue creates a notification which will be started at the time when the currently last expired notification deleted.

title: Make main thread actions sequential
body:
As listed in issue: #16, the pomodoro main thread can handle more operations sequentially without the overhead of creating tokio threads.

It should be noted that the CREATE option has  been refactored and moved to a separate method, but it would still be quite necessary a refactor for the whole system (isolating different logics, like for example the DataBase logic has to be completely decoupled from main.rs, the parsing arguments part should be delegated to argument.rs, and so much more) but this has to be thinked and talked in another issue.

In addition, I can say that theoretically this pull request does not break any of the current functionalities of the code (since I have tested the application and it seems to work the same as before), although, as at the moment there are no unit tests, I cannot ensure that this is true for the 100% of cases.
